result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor Jon Bevers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Report to Probation today 04-27-2016
- Probation can be transferred to MN with a transfer fee of $150.00 paid today
- Run concurrent with Ct.2 in 15CF382
- May apply for expungement upon successfull completion of probation
-
Concurrent with: Ct. 2 in 15CF382

AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Trevor Jon Bevers appeared.  Court called at 2:45 p.m.  Includes case 16CM323 (STC) & 15CF203 & 15CF382 (SEH on REV.)  Court proceeds with Plea/Sentencing on 16CM323   State moves to stike the repeater on Ct. 1.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1  without the repeater.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 with the repeater stricken. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 2 & Ct. 3.  Sentencing arguments for 16CM323 & on the revocation on 15CF203 & 15CF382. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 in 15CF203 & Ct. 1 15CF382 to run concurrent 
- DE sentenced to 6 months in the St. Croix County Jail
- Credit for 44 days time served
- Huber for work

Ct. 1 in 16CM323 to run concurrent with Ct. 1 in 15CF203 & Ct. 1 in 15CF382
- DE sentenced 90 days in the St. Croix County Jail
- Court costs of $243.00 and $200 for the DNA Surcharge and $6.91 for restitution 
- DE to provide the SCC Jail with a DNA Sample
- DE to meet with the payment clerk before being released for a payment plan
- 20 days to appeal
Atty. A. Andrea. gme
and supporting documentation filed by filed by DOC. gme

cc: DA, DE, SCSO, Atty Kucinski. hml
Electronic to DOC

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Trevor Jon Bevers appeared.  Court called.  Includes case 15CF203, 15CF382 & 16CF121.   Set for STC.  There is an agreement.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 in 15CF203 to Misdemeanor Possession of THC (same statute).  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to the amended Ct 1 in 15CF203 (Misdemeanor Possession of THC) .  Crt reviews the deputies report.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct 1 in 15CF203.   DE pleads No Contest to Ct. 2 in 15CF382.  Crt reviews the police reports.  Crt accepts the plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct. 2 in 15CF382.  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CF382 & 16CF121. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 in 15CF203 & Ct. 2 in 15CF382 to run concurrent to each other
- S/W 1 year probation with conditions
- Probation can be transferred to Minnesota with a transfer fee of $150 paid today
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA and follow through with any recommended threapy or treatment
- 973.015 allows for expungment upon sucessfully completing probation
- Court waives costs for 15CF203 and orders only court costs of $243.00 and a DNA surcharge of $200 for 15CF382 to be paid through the DOC
- DE to go downstairs and provide a DNA sample
- DE to report to probation today 04/27/16
- 20 days to appeal
Status conference on April 27, 2016 at 10:00 am.
